title: 104_hr3561
content: The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996, also known as the "Improved Efficiency in Health Care Resource Management Act," repeals the sunset provision of the Veterans Health Care Act of 1992 and introduces cost recovery measures by allowing billing of health-plan contracts. The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996, also known as the "Improved Efficiency in Health Care Resource Management Act," allows the United States to recover charges for care or services provided to primary beneficiaries with health-plan contracts from the respective health-plan contract. The funds received will be credited to the facility that provided the care. The right to recover under a beneficiary's health-plan contract is enforceable in a similar manner as specified in section 1729 of title 38, United States Code. SEC. 3. SHARING AGREEMENTS FOR HEALTH CARE RESOURCES. Repeal of Section 8151 in title 38, United States Code, involves redesignating sections and amending the table of sections. Section 8152 is revised to allow sharing agreements for health-care resources, expanding the scope beyond specialized medical resources. The curr_chunk involves amendments to subsections in a healthcare sharing agreement, expanding the entities eligible for participation and adjusting payment procedures. The amendments allow the Secretary to arrange services for non-veterans under certain conditions without compromising care for veterans. Additionally, there are cross-reference amendments to ensure accuracy in section numbers. Amendments to section numbers in Title 38, ensuring accuracy and allowing the Secretary to arrange services for non-veterans without compromising care for veterans. Section 712(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code is amended to include the number of positions in the Department held by individuals providing health-care resources under specific sections.
